name: MAPE Mydlovary
treatment: chemical processing plant uranium ore using acid and alkaline leaching and the storage of sludge at the tailings impoundment
description: 16.8 mil. metric tons of uranium ore were processed here, creating 28.5 thousand metric tons of pure uranium and, at the tailings impoundment, a total of 285 hectares were gradually filled with 35.8 mil. metric tons of sludge from processing

name: Okrouhlá Radouň
reserve_size: Extracted was a total of 1,339.5 metric tons of uranium.
treatment: chemical processing at the chemical processing plant in Mydlovary
description: 16.8 mil. metric tons of uranium ore were processed here, creating 28.5 thousand metric tons of pure uranium and, at the tailings impoundment, a total of 285 hectares were gradually filled with 35.8 mil. metric tons of sludge from processing
comment: Underground uranium mining – cut and fill stopping and gradual slicing. Soda leaching of sliced uranium ore.

name: Brzkov
reserve_size: 65.3 metric tons of uranium were extracted in total
description: One shaft, a smaller quarry and 6.6 km of horizontal mine tunnels were dug. The total area of the mine is 6.29 km2. Mining was conducted to a depth of 300 m beneath the surface.
comment: Open pit mining and underground mining of uranium – overhand stopping.

name: Stráž pod Ralskem
treatment: In situ leach (ISL) - using  H2SO4 + HNO3
description: chemical leaching using 7 684 production wells

name: Příbram - shaft 11A, Bytíz
reserve_size: Extracted was a total of 48,432.2 metric tons of uranium (total for Pribram region)
treatment: From 1958 the ore was processed on site at the physical processing plant in Bytíz and from 1962 at the chemical processing plant in Mydlovary as well.
description: There were 41 shafts (of which 14 were dead-ends), 42 prospecting shafts, four adits and 2,188.3 km of horizontal mine tunnels. The total mining area was 57.6 km2. Mining was conducted to a depth of approx. 1,400 m beneath the surface (the site was tested to a depth of 1,750 m).
comment: Underground uranium mining – cut-and-fill stopping and the selective method multi-level tunnels. Physical processing of uranium ore.

name: Damětice
reserve_size: Extracted was a total of 83.9 metric tons of uranium
treatment: ore processed in Horní Slavkov
description: shafts and open pits

name: Křižany I - pit no. 5
reserve_size: 1,108 metric tons of uranium were extracted
treatment: chemical processing at the chemical processing plants in Stráž pod Ralskem
description: There were two shafts and 24.7 km of horizontal mine tunnels. 665 prospecting boreholes were drilled into the surface. The total mining area is 13.7 km2. Mining was conducted to a depth of 190 m beneath the surface.
comment: Underground uranium mining – chamber and pillar method with solidifying backfill, sporadic walling and shearing.

name: Křižany I - pit no. 4
reserve_size: 1,108 metric tons of uranium were extracted
treatment: chemical processing at the chemical processing plants in Stráž pod Ralskem

comment: Underground uranium mining – chamber and pillar method with solidifying backfill, sporadic walling and shearing.

name: Hamr I - pit no. 3
reserve_size: 13,205.9 metric tons of uranium were extracted
treatment: chemical processing at the chemical processing plants in Mydlovary and Stráž pod Ralskem
description: Hamr I had four shafts and 68 km of horizontal tunnels where mining was conducted to a depth of 160 m beneath the surface. 2,051 prospecting boreholes (425,000 m) were drilled from the surface to the bed. The total mining area is 12.0 km2.
comment: Underground uranium mining – Chamber and pillar method along with solidifying earth and trial runs of wall slicing.

name: Jáchymov - Tailings impoundment Eliáš
deposit_type: storage of sludge from gravitational milling of uranium ore
treatment: chemical processing plant uranium ore using acid and alkaline leaching and the storage of sludge at the tailings impoundment
description: The tailings impoundment of the former physical processing plant Eliáš, situated on hilly terrain near the Eliáš ore deposit, in proximity to the Rovnost mine, was in operation from 1948 until 1962. Processed here was uranium ore from the Jáchymov, Horní Slavkov, Zadní Chodov and Příbram areas. After 1962 the processing facility was dismantled, sludge with a residual concentration of uranium from the tailings impoundment were removed to the processing plant at Mydlovary.

name: Jáchymov - Eliáš mine
treatment: processed with gravitational millingin, own storage of sludge
comment: Underground mining – silver since approx. 1512, uranium 1945-1962

name: Jáchymov - Rovnost mine
treatment: processed with gravitational millingin, own storage of sludge
description: lowest 12th floor in 660 meters
comment: Underground mining – silver since approx. 1792, uranium 1945-1962

name: Jáchymov - Bratrství mine
comment: today serves as a repository of radioactive material used in healthcare

name: Jáchymov - Josef mine
treatment: processed with gravitational milling, own storage of sludge
comment: silver mining since 1520, uranium sice 1948

name: Jáchymov - Svornost mine
description: lowest 12th floor in 660 meters
comment: Underground mining – silver since 1525, uranium 1945-1964. Sice 1964 owned by Jáchymov Spa and provides radioactive water (containing radon gas) for the spa.

name: Dyleň mine
reserve_size: 1,100.5 metric tons of uranium were extracted
treatment: chemical processing at the chemical processing plant in Mydlovary
description: Mining took place from 1965 until 1991. Firstly there was an open pit and later an underground mine with two shafts and 28.2 km of horizontal mine tunnels. The total area of the mine is 0.539 km2.
comment: Open pit mining – quarry and underground mining of uranium – open chamber method, overhand stopping and wall method.

name: Vítkov II mine
reserve_size: 3,972.6 metric tons of uranium were extracted
treatment: chemical processing at the chemical processing plant in Mydlovary
description: Mining took place from 1961 until 1991. There was an open pit and later an underground Vítkov II mine, two shafts, two prospecting shafts and 83 km of horizontal mine tunnels. The total area of the mine is 0.99 km2. Mining was conducted to a depth of 1,050 m beneath the surface.
comment: Open pit and underground mining – cut and fill stopping and gradual slicing.

name: Zadní Chodov mine
reserve_size: 4,150.7 metric tons of uranium were extracted
treatment: chemical processing at the chemical processing plant in Mydlovary
description: Mining took place from 1953 until 1993. There were five shafts and 167.4 km of horizontal mine tunnels. The total area of the mine is 7.2 km2. Mining was conducted to a depth of 1,200 m beneath the surface.
comment: Underground uranium mining – cut and fill stopping and gradual slicing of walls under an artificial ceiling.

name: Horní Slavkov - Svatopluk mine
reserve_size: 2,668.3 metric tons of uranium were extracted
treatment: The ore was processed at the gravitational mill at Eliáš, Bratrství and at the chemical processing plant in Nejdek.
description: Mining took place from 1948 until 1962. There were 26 shafts, 33 adits and two tailings impoundments. The total area of the mine was 21.7 km2.

name: Nejdek - tailings impoundment of the chemical uranium ore processing plant
Name_ascii: Nejdek - tailings impoundment of the chemical uranium ore processing plant
deposit_type: storage of sludge from the chemical processing of acid leached uranium ore
treatment: chemical processing plant uranium ore using acid and alkaline leaching and the storage of sludge at the tailings impoundment
description: The tailings impoundment of the chemical uranium ore processing plant in Nejdek, situated on the site of a former paper mill in the district of Vysoká Pec, was in operation from 1952 until 1959. Processed here was uranium ore from all of the mining districts of the time including Trutnov uranium coal. The processing plant operated at a rate of up to 270 metric tons of ore per day. After 1959 the processing facility was dismantled.
comment: Outflow of contaminated water from the tailings impoundment has contaminated surface and underground water. There is proven inundation of a stretch of the Rolava River. A sub-standard and devastated drainage and stoppage system is in danger of disrupting the barrier. Urgent reconstruction of the drainage system is required.

name: Dolní Rožínka - chemical uranium ore processing plant
Name_ascii: Dolni Rozinka - chemical uranium ore processing plant
deposit_type: storage of sludge from the chemical processing of acid leached uranium ore
treatment: chemical processing plant uranium ore using acid and alkaline leaching and the storage of sludge at the tailings impoundment
description: The run-of-mine ore was extracted from the depth of over 1,000 m below the surface and, subsequently, refined to uranium in chemical concentrate in the chemical processing plant at CHÚ mill, where U-metal is also refined by sorption at ionexes in decontamination stations during treatment of mine water. Sodium sulphate is the by-product of the purification of sludge water in the treatment division.
comment: Mining on deposit Rožná was terminated on the 31. December 2016. Treatment of mine water was carried out in localities where mining activities were discontinued in the framework of inhibition of the mining activities.

name: Rožná I mine
reserve_size: To 2016, 20,494 metric tons of uranium were extracted (total for both Rožná mines - probably). Annual extraction is around 300 metric tons.
treatment: chemical processing (alkaline leaching) at the chemical processing plant in Dolní Rožínka
description: Mining began in 1958. From 1968 a chemical processing plant and two tailings impoundments have been in operation. 11 shafts and approx. 580 km of mine tunnels have been dug at the site. Mining is being conducted to a depth of between 950 to 1,100 m beneath the surface. The mining area is 8.76 km2.
comment: Underground uranium mining – gradual wall slicing under a man-made ceiling, overhand stopping with backfill, the selective method from multi-level tunnels. A chemical uranium ore processing plant (alkaline leaching) and storage of sludge at the tailings impoundments.

name: Rožná II mine
reserve_size: To 2016, 20,494 metric tons of uranium were extracted (total for both Rožná mines - probably). Annual extraction is around 300 metric tons.
treatment: chemical processing (alkaline leaching) at the chemical processing plant in Dolní Rožínka
description: Mining began in 1958. From 1968 a chemical processing plant and two tailings impoundments have been in operation. 11 shafts and approx. 580 km of mine tunnels have been dug at the site. Mining is being conducted to a depth of between 950 to 1,100 m beneath the surface. The mining area is 8.76 km2.
comment: Underground uranium mining – gradual wall slicing under a man-made ceiling, overhand stopping with backfill, the selective method from multi-level tunnels. A chemical uranium ore processing plant (alkaline leaching) and storage of sludge at the tailings impoundments.

name: Olší - Rudý říjen mine
reserve_size: 2,922.2 metric tons of uranium were extracted
treatment: chemical processing at the chemical processing plant in Rožná
description: Mining took place from 1959 until 1989. There were five shafts (three were dead-ends), three prospecting shafts, two adits and 141.4 km of horizontal mine tunnels. The total area of the mine is 6.29 km2.
comment: Underground uranium mining – gradual wall slicing under a man-made ceiling, selective multi-level method.

name: Pucov mine
reserve_size: Extracted was a total of 311.2 metric tons of uranium
description: Mining took place after prospecting at Jasenice – Pucov from 1963 until 1967, and from 1974 until 1991. One shaft, three prospecting shafts, two adits, an open pit quarry and 15.4 km of horizontal mine tunnels were dug. The total area of the mine is 0.278 km2. Extracted were a total of 311.2 metric tons of uranium. Mining was conducted to a depth of 400 m beneath the surface.

name: Licoměřice - mine and ore processing facility
Name_ascii: Licomerice - mine and ore processing facility
reserve_size: 383.3 metric tons of uranium were extracted
treatment: biological leaching of mine water (pH = 3 - 4 with free H2SO4) and aerobic bacteria (thiobacillus ferooxidentali)
description: Mining took place from 1968 until 1982. From 1977 until 1985 biological leaching of mine water took place here (pH = 3 - 4 with free H2SO4) and aerobic bacteria (thiobacillus ferooxidentali).There were two shafts (one dead-end), one adit and nine km of horizontal mine tunnels. The total area of the mine was 0.348 km2.
